I hosted a young Emirati man who was blind today. He called my office and expressed his desire to buy a book of flashes of thought. We printed it in Braille and his first edition was http://t.co/msnCvEMVfm
The young man named Ahmed al-Ghafli .. Although lost sight of the blessing .. did not lose the blessing of insight, educated .. collectors .. Media .. A lover of poetry and life ..
I heard about Ahmad that he loves and follows football matches .. He encourages Al Ahli enthusiastically to follow his games with listening and interacting with them .. He also has his radio program
Ahmed model of will .. A beautiful story about the positive in life .. And an example of our ability to achieve despite the strength of the challenge .. He and others inspire us all
There is no good life and bad one .. There is no beautiful world and another difficult .. Only positive outlook optimistic or negative outlook pessimistic ..

Pillars of good governance, rooted in the rule of law, are being erected to check corruption.
It is not only my duty as President to fight corruption but it is also my civic duty as a Ghanaian to champion this fight.
We must think outside the box because the old ways will not meet the expectations of our people.

It is true, the vote is voluntary. But it is also true that we all have a commitment to Chile. That's why he called him to vote this Sunday.
This Sunday the voice of the candidates will be turned off and their voice and the voice of the people will be heard loud and clear. That is the essence
That is the essence and beauty of democracy. The candidates propose and you arrange. Let your voice and all the voices be heard.
This Sunday, when you are alone with your conscience in front of the box, think about Chile, your family and the future. Then vote in conscience.
